snippet: A federal judge on Thursday ordered Florida to stop enforcing several “burdensome” regulations on voter registration groups, but left in place the rest of a 2011 law tightening election rules.
abstract: Federal Judge Robert L Hinkle orders Florida to stop enforcing several requirements on voter registration groups that were part of a law passed in 2011 to tighten election rules; regulations had proved so unworkable that prominent voter advocacy organizations had stopped registering Floridians to vote.
lead_paragraph: A federal judge on Thursday ordered Florida to stop enforcing several “burdensome” regulations on voter registration groups, but left in place the rest of a 2011 law tightening election rules.

headline.seo: Judge Opposes Restrictions on Florida’s Voter Groups
headline.main: Judge Blocks Florida’s Voter Drive Rules
headline.print_headline: Judge Blocks Florida’s Voter Drive Rules
